column2: # Note that R can't use the "success" variables at-base since they're strings.
# factor(sucess) converts success from string to levels.
summary(fitted.model<- glm(factor(success) ~ cover.rel + methods.rel + novelamount.rel + years,

glm(formula = factor(success) ~ cover.rel + methods.rel + novelamount.rel + 
    years, family = binomial(link = logit), data = novel.data)
Null deviance: 60.176  on 43  degrees of freedom
Residual deviance: 32.071  on 37  degrees of freedom
# Sprintf is used to make the output clearer.
sprintf("The deviance test value is %s", deviance)
sprintf("The deviance test p-value is %s", deviance_pval)
